title: ICE: library/core/src/slice/index.rs:73:5: out of range slice

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Minimal "readable" code: ```rust #[derive(Print)] struct Foo<#[cfg] A, B> { third: [u8; { #[cfg] let a = #[cfg] u8, #[] bool, ``` via [comby-reducer](https://github.com/comby-tools/comby-reducer) Truly minimized: ```rust #[derive(P]struct o<#[cfg]B>{t:[0;{#[cfg]let 0=#[cfg]0, ``` via `afl-tmin` on the above ### Meta On nightly `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.0-nightly (4ca19e09d 2022-04-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: 4ca19e09d302a4cbde14f9cb1bc109179dc824cd commit-date: 2022-04-19 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.62.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'range end index 9 out of range for slice of length 8', library/core/src/slice/index.rs:73:5 ```
Backtrace

### Notes I searched through ICE issues and believe this is not a duplicate, but let me know! Found with compiler fuzzing tools [`comby-decomposer`](https://github.com/comby-tools/comby-decomposer) and [`afl-compiler-fuzzer`](https://github.com/agroce/afl-compiler-fuzzer)
